meanings.definition: Act dishonestly or unfairly in order to gain an advantage.
meanings.sent1: He tried to cheat by peeking at the answers during the test.
meanings.sent2: She felt guilty after she realized her friend was trying to cheat on the game.
meanings.sent3: The magician's rabbit tried to cheat by hiding in the hat instead of coming out.
meanings.sent4: The sun seemed to cheat by peeking through the clouds on the rainy day.
meanings.sent5: The student's attempt to cheat was quickly noticed by the teacher.

meanings.sent1: The scammer tried to cheat the old lady out of her savings.
meanings.sent2: He didn't want to cheat his friend, so he decided to tell the truth.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to cheat the dog by hiding behind the curtains.
meanings.sent4: The shadows seemed to cheat the light by dancing on the wall.
meanings.sent5: She felt betrayed when she realized her partner was trying to cheat her.

meanings.definition: Avoid something undesirable by luck or skill.
meanings.sent1: He managed to cheat death by narrowly escaping the car accident.
meanings.sent2: She tried to cheat the rain by running faster to reach home.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox tried to cheat the hunter by leaving false tracks.
meanings.sent4: The butterfly seemed to cheat the wind by fluttering gracefully in the air.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's determination helped him cheat defeat and win the race.

meanings.definition: A person who acts dishonestly or unfairly in order to gain an advantage.
meanings.sent1: The cheat was caught red-handed while trying to alter the scores.
meanings.sent2: She didn't want to be friends with a cheat who always lied.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky raccoon was known as the neighborhood cheat for stealing food.
meanings.sent4: The cheat in the game seemed to have an unfair advantage over the others.
meanings.sent5: The cheat's reputation spread quickly among the students in the school.
